description: A 3D curve (e.g., a helix or a twisted cubic) with a specific point marked on it. A straight line should be drawn passing through this point, representing the tangent line, and an arrow indicating the tangent vector's direction along this line.

A 3D surface (e.g., a sphere, paraboloid, or saddle surface) with a specific point marked on it. A flat plane should be drawn passing through this point, representing the tangent plane. A vector should be drawn originating from the point and perpendicular to the tangent plane, representing the normal vector.
